Class com.bastel.democomp.Memory 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----com.bastel.democomp.ComponentListener
           |
           +----com.bastel.democomp.Memory
public class Memory
extends ComponentListener
Root class for all objects containing Memory

Version:
0.1
Author:
Beno Kurmann, Michel Marti

Memory(int, int, int, String)
Constructs a new Memory-Object

getAddress()
Return's the currently selected Address within the memory object (The last address that was reveived from the AddressBus)
getBit(int, int)
Returns a a bit from Memory
getWord(int)
Returns a Word from Memory
isReadOnly()
Determines wheter this Memory-Object is "writeable" or "read-only"
reset()
Reset's the component.
setBit(int, int, boolean)
Sets a bit at the given address
setDataBus(Bus)
Assigns a DataBus to this object.
setReadOnly(boolean)
Change the writeability of this object.
setWord(int, Word)
Stores a word at the specified memory-adress
wordChanged(Word, int, String)
Handle incoming word from one of the busses

Memory 
 public Memory(int size,
               int width,
               int offset,
               String id)
Constructs a new Memory-Object

Parameters:
size - Number of Words in Memory object
width - Word width
offset - Offset of memory block within adress space
id - Object-Identification. Will be used for communication issues

setDataBus 
 public void setDataBus(Bus databus)
Assigns a DataBus to this object. The Databus will be used to broadcast requested words to all Listeners of the DataBus

setReadOnly 
 public void setReadOnly(boolean value)
Change the writeability of this object. If the object is write protected, the object throws an Exception when attempting to write to it.

reset 
 public void reset() throws IOException
Reset's the component. If the component isn't write protected, the memory cells will be set to 0

Overrides:
reset in class ComponentListener
setWord 
 public void setWord(int address,
                     Word word) throws IllegalAccessException
Stores a word at the specified memory-adress

Parameters:
address - Address at which the Word will be stored
Word - Word to store
Throws: IllegalAccessException
If the address exceeds the memory boundaries
getWord 
 public Word getWord(int address) throws IllegalAccessException
Returns a Word from Memory

Parameters:
address - Address of desired Word
Throws: IllegalAccessException
If the address exceeds the memory boundaries
setBit 
 public void setBit(int address,
                    int offset,
                    boolean value) throws IllegalAccessException
Sets a bit at the given address

Parameters:
address - Address of Word in Memory
offset - bit to change
Throws: IllegalAccessException
If the given address or offset exceeds the memory or word boundaries
getBit 
 public boolean getBit(int address,
                       int offset) throws IllegalAccessException
Returns a a bit from Memory

Parameters:
address - Address of desired Word
offset - Desired bit within addressed word
Throws: IllegalAccessException
If the given address or offset exceeds the memory or word boundaries
wordChanged 
 public void wordChanged(Word word,
                         int address,
                         String id) throws IllegalAccessException
Handle incoming word from one of the busses

Overrides:
wordChanged in class ComponentListener
See Also:
wordChanged
isReadOnly 
 public boolean isReadOnly()
Determines wheter this Memory-Object is "writeable" or "read-only"

getAddress 
 public int getAddress()
Return's the currently selected Address within the memory object (The last address that was reveived from the AddressBus)
